title: Vegetable Crop Rotation on Small Farms with Jordan Scheibel and Hannah Breckbill

subtasks: Explaining the farm's location and experience
Describing the farm's land use, including high tunnels, intensive market garden beds, and tractor-managed fields
Discussing crop rotation management and disease prevention strategies
Detailing weed and cover crop considerations in different field types
Presenting field maps and crop rotation plans
Highlighting the use of high tunnels for extended season production
Addressing the challenges and adjustments in crop rotation due to market changes and farm scale
Sharing experiences with no-till farming and cover crop management
Responding to questions about crop rotation, cover crop breakdown, and weed control methods
Discussing the integration of compost and mulch in high-value crop production
Presenting the farm's diverse crop technique evolution and decisions.
